intro: Tagetes lacera, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or dwarf marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Tagetes lacera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties.
